definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: If you work in a factory, you usually have to punch a clock.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在工厂工作，你就要在上下班记时卡上打孔。

sentences.english: The network is already creating a new class of intercity commuters.
sentences.chinese: 铁路网络已经造就一批在城际间上下班的新群体。

sentences.english: But if that's too much of a commute, try Eastbourne.
sentences.chinese: 如果你嫌那里上下班人流过大，可以试试去伊斯特本。

sentences.english: Walking in the daily on the way to pass, See the fallen leaves all over the ground.
sentences.chinese: 走在那条每天上下班要经过的路，只见落叶满地都是。

sentences.english: For two solid weeks, Mark, military uniform and all, accompanied Susan to and from work each day.
sentences.chinese: 整整两个星期，全身戎装的马克每天陪着苏姗上下班。

sentences.english: The commuters were packed into metro like sardines in a can.
sentences.chinese: 上下班的人把地铁挤得像沙丁鱼罐头一样。

sentences.english: Try to keep your commute time to a minimum.
sentences.chinese: 尝试着把你上下班的时间降到最小值。

sentences.english: If you work in a factory, you usually have to.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在工厂工作，你就要在上下班记时卡上打孔。

sentences.english: It is a bad time to travel underground. Crowds of people are rushing home from work at this time.
sentences.chinese: 这时候乘地铁最糟糕了，大家正上下班挤车回家。

sentences.english: Let's consider Mr. Wheeler, the average American car commuter.
sentences.chinese: 让我们看看一个开车上下班的普通美国人惠勒先生。

sentences.english: He usually rides bike to and from work .
The minimum salary could not even cover the commuter costs.
sentences.chinese: 最低工资甚至不够支付上下班交通费。

sentences.english: Most adults in the US have a commute of over 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，大多数成年人的上下班时间都超过20分钟。

sentences.english: So I ride that down to work and back.
But yeah, commuting in from outside London is a pretty expensive business.
sentences.chinese: 但是，确实，从伦敦市区外面上下班往返相当贵。

sentences.english: Wu says it takes her 3 hours to get to and from work now.
sentences.chinese: 吴说现在她上下班要花上3个小时。

definition: to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
to take the car, bus, train etc
to finish work/to get off work
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
to go out somewhere (relatively short trip)/to set off on a journey (longer trip)
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
